title: Genesis

flashback.speaker: Nergal
flashback.line: …I name you Kishuna. You are the only morph to whom I’ve given emotions. It won’t suffice simply to refer to you as a number. It is said man was sculpted by the hands of the gods. If so, then you, who were sculpted by these, my hands… And I, whose labors gave you breath and life… What are we, then? What does that make us? In your fabricated heart, which I gave unto you, what is it that you believe, Kishuna?

opening: Eliwood: Oof... A rock wall?... Where am I? ...Where is everyone?
Pent: Hello. You're awake! Are you well?
Eliwood: ...You're...from before...
Pent: Hawkeye's friend.
Hawkeye: ......
Eliwood: Um... Hawkeye? What is this place?
Hawkeye: ...I don't know.
Pent: Eh? You don't know? I would never have imagined a place such as this existed.
Hawkeye: My master never spoke of anything like this.
Nils: Ah! Lord Eliwood! I'm so glad I found you.
Eliwood: Nils! Is everyone all right?
Nils: Yes, they're nearby. I can't see them, but... I can sense them. So they must be OK.
Eliwood: That's good.
Nils: Do you know where we are? I wonder how we get out of here...
Eliwood: I'd like to know, too.
Pent: ...Something strange is here. I can feel it in the air.
Nils: Yes! You're right. It's strange. Unsettling!
Hawkeye: Pent, doesn't that sound like...
Pent: ...Like a magic seal.
Eliwood: What's that?
Pent: I'm not entirely certain how to explain it. It's...someone whose very presence nullifies all magic.
Eliwood: Why would this person be here? Why now?
Pent: I have no idea. All I know is that we're being watched.
Nils: Uh-oh! Something's happening!
Hector: Ow ow ow... I really smacked my head that time! Eliwood! Lyn! Where are you?
Pent: Hello. You’re awake! Are you well?
Hector: ...You... You’re...
Pent: Hawkeye’s friend.
Hawkeye: ......
Hector: Where in the world are we?
Hawkeye: ...I don’t know.
Pent: Huh? You don’t know? Look at this place... It’s terrible. Bleak. Dreadful.
Hawkeye: My master never spoke of anything like this.
Nils: Ah! Lord Hector! I’m so glad you’re alive!
Hector: Where’s everyone else?
Nils: They’re nearby. I can’t see them, but... I can sense them. So they must be OK.
Hector: Right. That’s good.
Nils: Do you know where we are? I wonder how we get out of here.
Hector: Don’t ask me. I’ve never seen any place like this before.
Pent: ...Something strange is here. I can feel it in the air.
Nils: Yes! You’re right. It feels...thick!
Hector: This strange feeling... I know it... I’ve felt it before. Back on Valor.
Nils: On the Dread Isle?
Hector: Mm. We first felt it in some ruins near the Dragon’s Gate. It was...a prickly feeling that rubbed us all the wrong way. Then, suddenly, everyone’s magic stopped working.
Hawkeye: Pent, doesn’t that sound like...
Pent: ...Like a magic seal.
Hector: What’s that?
Pent: I’m not entirely certain how to explain it. It’s...someone whose very presence nullifies all magic.
Hector: Why would anyone like that be here? Why right now?
Pent: I have no idea. All I know is that we’re being watched.
Nils: Uh-oh! Something’s happening!

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: He... He's called some friends. They are...very powerful.

intro.speaker: Pent
intro.line: He summoned them here? I'm beginning to suspect the magic seal created this place.

intro.speaker: Hawkeye
intro.line: If we kill him, can we get out of here?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Then we fight! If they have strength, then we'll match their strength and challenge them! We don't have time for this!!

intro.speaker: Hawkeye
intro.line: I will fight, too. Pent, you stay here and guard the others.

intro.speaker: Hawkeye
intro.line: Select those who will go with us. ...And choose carefully.

battle.speaker: Eliwood
battle.line: All right! Are you ready, everyone? Try not to get separated.

battle.speaker: Hawkeye
battle.line: ...He's responsible. He's watching us from somewhere.

battle.speaker: Hawkeye
battle.line: Mark, is it? I must see you all safely back to my master. If you have need of it, I will lend you my strength.

end.speaker: Pent
end.line: The air... It's returned to normal! The magic seal has fled.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: What in the name of all that is decent is that? It has human form, but it's... It's not human!

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: ...That was a creature of heresy. Its existence makes a ruin of nature's most basic laws.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Ninian?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: ...Ah, Lord Eliwood. I...

end.speaker: Pent
end.line: ...In this world, there are many mysterious things that fall beyond our realm of understanding. Come, let us leave this place. A living legend awaits us.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Ah... Yes!

end.speaker: Hawkeye
end.line: ...Daughter of...

end.speaker: Hawkeye
end.line: ......Be strong...

end.speaker: Hawkeye
end.line: ...I've brought them.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Welcome, children of Roland.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: We've come from Lycia, old man. Do you understand?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What do you mean?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I think I know. Thousands of years ago, man and dragon fought on this continent.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Yes, mankind won, and the dragons fled this world.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: That's correct. Man against dragon... That war that we know as the Scouring. And you know of the Eight Legends, the heroes who led man to victory?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Yes, we've all heard the stories of the Eight Legends. I was raised in Sacae, so I know of Hanon, the horseman.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Sacae is where Hanon was born. Our country, Lycia, was founded by the hero Roland.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: That's why you called us "children of Roland," right?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: That is correct, daughter of Hanon and Roland.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Who are you?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: I am Athos. Many choose simply to call me Archsage.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Athos?! It can't be...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Huh? What?!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Archsage Athos was one of the Eight Legends. If you really were him, old man... you'd have to be over a thousand years old.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: The world is full of mysteries. Solve one, and along comes another... Before I knew, I'd grown distant from my fellow man. Hunger... It knows no bounds.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: A thousand years... That's a long time.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Yet thanks to such longevity, we're meeting here today.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: "Living legend"... Now I see it.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: You're here because you want to stop Nergal, aren't you?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Yes. Did you receive word from Marquess Ostia?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: No... I am aware of most things that occur on the continent. However, knowledge is not enough for me to prevent disaster.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Nils said something similar to that before. "With my special power, I can sense danger coming, but I can't do anything to stop it."

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Nils... One of the children of destiny.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: He's here with us, but something outside caught his attention.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: ...I'm sure something stopped him...

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hm?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Let's talk about Nergal. How do we stop him?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Yes, what can you tell us? What wisdom can you share?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Mm. Your foe is, like me, no longer...altogether human. It will be difficult to slay him through traditional means. He wields a terrible power. His endless strength stems from an ancient, forbidden magic... To defeat him, you will need a suitable response.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Response?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: ...While he is resting, you must find the power to oppose him.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Tell us what it is! We'll do anything!!

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: It will be harder than you can imagine. Great trials await you. ...As does great despair. You may regret your decision. Will you stay the course, children?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: ...Our will remains fixed.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: This is a road from which you cannot turn back.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: We've known that all along!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: We can overcome anything. You'll see. Together, we are strong.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: ...Very well. Let me tell you what you must do.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Have you understood all that you have heard?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Yes. We are to seek out the Shrine of Seals in Bern, right?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Take Hawkeye with you. Add his skills to your own.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Thank you.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: ...And you? What will you do, Pent and Louise?

end.speaker: Pent
end.line: Nergal, a magic user who rivals you, Lord Athos... And the return of the dragons. An intriguing story.

end.speaker: Pent
end.line: Forgive the late introductions. I am Pent, Count Reglay of Etruria. This is Louise, my wife.

end.speaker: Louise
end.line: It's nice to meet you.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Count Reglay? You are Count Reglay?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Who? Is he someone special?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Yes. He hails from the most prominent noble house in Etruria. He's known as the Magic General. What has brought you to this place?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Bern's successor will soon have his coming-of-age ceremony. Pent and Louise are to attend as representatives of Etruria. Pent claimed there was time to search the desert for a magic artifact said to have been lost in the sands here long ago. You arrived shortly after we did. Perhaps something was guiding you.

end.speaker: Pent
end.line: Bowing to the dictates of fate, my wife and I would like to join you if we may.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Well, of course. That's fine, right, Eliwood? Will you send word of your mission to your countrymen?

end.speaker: Pent
end.line: There's no reason to, and if we did, who would believe us? Besides, it's not unusual for us to remain absent for long periods. I doubt anyone will be surprised by our absence. Right, my dear?

end.speaker: Louise
end.line: Tee hee. You're right, my love.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Not unlike a certain young noble we've heard of...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: That's great! Thanks a lot!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: In any event, we welcome you both with all our hearts.

end.speaker: Pent
end.line: Thank you.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: ...There's not much time. I'll send you to Lycia. Hawkeye! Gather everyone here in the plaza.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: You are Tactician, correct? Fate blows a strange wind in your direction. Much rides on your shoulders and in your abilities. I want you to take this. It enhances natural abilities, skills with which one was born. Give this to whomever you feel will benefit the most. Do not waste its power holding on to it. Use it.

end.speaker: Hawkeye
end.line: Everyone is here.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Thank you. Eliwood, your territory is the closest to Bern, is it not?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Yes. The border lies in the mountains.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Very good. Now please envision a nice, wide place in Pherae... Next, think of the name of a person you might meet there.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: As you say. ... ...

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Now, children of Roland, it is time to say farewell. You must reach the Shrine of Seals. There, your destinies' doors will open wide before you.

end.speaker: Eleanora
end.line: My beloved... I cannot believe you are gone. Every time I close my eyes, I see you at my side. Your memory haunts me, and I am filled with sorrow. ...Elbert... If by some chance you can hear my prayer... Please look after our son.
Mother...

end.speaker: Eleanora
end.line: What!? Eliwood? Where--Where are you?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Mother! I'm home! I've returned!

end.speaker: Eleanora
end.line: Ah!! Eliwood! Is it really you? Oh, how did you... You startled me so!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Forgive me, Mother. The Archsage sent us.

end.speaker: Eleanora
end.line: You look so tired. ...Have you lost weight? Oh, come closer and let me see your face.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: ...Mother, about Father...

end.speaker: Eleanora
end.line: I heard his last moments were glorious. Though he's gone, he will ever be my life's joy.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I know.

end.speaker: Eleanora
end.line: Come... Let us make everyone comfortable. You all look in need of a rest.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I'm sorry, Mother. We must hurry onward...

end.speaker: Eleanora
end.line: I know that! But for one night... here in the castle... Eliwood... just for tonight.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Mother...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: One night's not going to hurt us. Who knows when we'll be back this way?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Yes, let's do it. I am so exhausted.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector, Lyn... Thank you.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hello, Tactician. So you're still awake. Tactician, do you know Bern well? No, nor do I... Nothing more than I've heard at court. I'm sure that, with all of your travels, you know more than I. By the way, Tactician, where were you born? Before you met Lyndis in Sacae, where were you? If it's difficult to speak about, you needn't worry. It's just that we've been together for so long, and I really know almost nothing about you. If you don't mind, won't you tell me about yourself? I would like to learn more about you and your life.
